name: Migrate secrets from Credstash table to kubestash table.txt - Migrate secrets from Credstash table to kubestash table
description: This section explains the process of migrating secrets from the Credstash system to the Kubestash system. It provides the URLs for accessing the Credstash environments (production and stage) and highlights the difference in how secrets are stored in each system. It also includes instructions for setting up the AWS environment and executing a script to perform the migration.
use_cases: Migrating secrets from Credstash to Kubestash
Setting up AWS environment for migration
Executing a script to perform the migration

name: Migrate secrets from Credstash table to kubestash table.txt - Execute below script
description: This section explains a script that helps migrate secrets from one storage system (Credstash table) to another (Kubestash table). The script prompts the user to enter the names of the source and destination tables, as well as a namespace and secret name for the destination. It retrieves all secrets from the Credstash table, modifies their names to include the specified namespace and secret name, and then stores them in the Kubestash table. This allows for seamless migration of sensitive data between different storage systems.
use_cases: Migrating secrets from one storage system to another
Consolidating secrets under a specific namespace and secret name
Transitioning from Credstash to Kubestash for secret management
capabilities: Modifying secret names with namespace and secret name
User input for source table, destination table, namespace, and secret name
Temporary file storage for migration data
Command-line interface for executing the migration script

name: Migrate secrets from Credstash table to kubestash table.txt - Verify in console
description: This section instructs the user to verify the names of the Credstash table and the namespace in the console. Credstash is likely a service or tool used for storing and managing secrets, and the user needs to confirm the correct table and namespace before proceeding with the migration process.
use_cases: Migrating secrets from one storage system (Credstash) to another (kubestash)
Verifying the correct table and namespace for the migration process
Managing and storing sensitive data (secrets) securely

name: Migrate secrets from Credstash table to kubestash table.txt - Verify the secrets in kubernetes
description: This section explains the process of verifying the migration of secrets from a Credstash table to a Kubestash table in Kubernetes. It involves reading secrets from the Credstash table, converting them to a Kubestash format, and storing them in a temporary JSON file. This file is then used to create the corresponding secrets in the Kubernetes cluster, which can take around 10-15 minutes. The section provides screenshots to illustrate the verification process in the console and the Kubernetes cluster.
use_cases: Migrating secrets from one storage system (Credstash) to another (Kubestash)
Securely managing and storing sensitive data (secrets) in Kubernetes
Verifying the successful migration of secrets to the new storage system
Monitoring the creation of secrets in the Kubernetes cluster
capabilities: Storing converted secrets in a temporary JSON file
